cdb70050-c23a-4bf3-9406-47fc5276f435.description: Offered by the Office of Interprofessional Education to students in health professions education programs, this badge introduces students to interprofessional collaboration skills essential for effective, state-of-the art effective and efficient person-centered and population-based care. Earners of this badge will develop foundational knowledge of the roles and responsibilities of healthcare providers, communication, and interprofessional teamwork.
cdb70050-c23a-4bf3-9406-47fc5276f435.name: Interprofessional Collaborative Practice Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following interprofessional learning experiences: Interprofessional Collaborative Practice online course;Fall Interprofessional Forum; Spring Interprofessional Forum.

33ad5101-d707-425b-8b86-9562e3cdced0.description: Offered by the Office of Interprofessional Education to students in health professions education programs, this badge advances the interprofessional collaboration skills learned in the IPCP Foundations badge. Using simulation, community-based service learning, and/or other experiential education, earners of this badge are able to collaborate with health professionals to utilize each other’s expertise to provide effective and efficient person-centered and population-based care.
33ad5101-d707-425b-8b86-9562e3cdced0.name: Interprofessional Communication and Teamwork Skills: Immersive Experiences

badge_template_activities.title: Complete interprofessional learning experiences during the clinical or practical educational experiences for your health professions program. Please see the website for a list of experiences available for each health professions program.

f4baaf7d-c915-4555-aa05-3b002f69ce87.description: Offered by Experiential Learning Network at the University at Buffalo, this badge recognizes successful completion of a mentored community engagement project. Badge earners have completed the requirements for project preparation, engagement and reflection, and demonstrated their ability to leverage their project experience through capacity building and storytelling.
f4baaf7d-c915-4555-aa05-3b002f69ce87.name: Community Engagement

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the following criteria: Create a plan to further leverage project experience; enhance resume by translating experience and skills; articulate growth and development through storytelling.

3769e7f5-0f87-48da-88fa-71e78e0bc668.description: Offered by the Office of Interprofessional Education to students in health professions education programs, this badge advances the interprofessional collaboration skills learned in the IPCP Foundations badge to the healthcare setting. Earners of this badge are able to use effective teamwork and communication skills to collaborate respectfully and ethically with healthcare providers, patients, families, and communities to deliver high quality health services and optimize health outcomes.
3769e7f5-0f87-48da-88fa-71e78e0bc668.name: Interprofessional Health Care in the Practice Setting

badge_template_activities.title: Complete interprofessional learning experiences using simulation, community-based service learning, and/or other experiential education. Please see the website for a list of experiences available for each health professions program.

a30fe302-eb95-4507-80b2-62f4f6ecf456.description: Offered by the Office of Interprofessional Education to students in health professions education programs, this badge recognizes completion of the full Interprofessional Collaborative practice micro-credential. Earners have succesfully completed all requirements for the three required digital badges: IPCP Foundations, IPCP Communication and Teamwork, and IPCP Healthcare Practice.
a30fe302-eb95-4507-80b2-62f4f6ecf456.name: Interprofessional Collaborative Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Interprofessional Collaborative Practice Foundations
Interprofessional Communication and Teamwork Skills: Immersive Experiences
Interprofessional Health Care in the Practice Setting

11040a82-6fdb-49e1-b979-e55994f7bb42.description: Offered by Experiential Learning Network at the University at Buffalo, this badge recognizes successful completion of a mentored research project. Badge earners have completed the requirements for project preparation, engagement and reflection, and demonstrated their ability to leverage their project experience through capacity building and storytelling.
11040a82-6fdb-49e1-b979-e55994f7bb42.name: Mentored Research

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the following criteria: Create a plan to further leverage project experience; enhance resume by translating experience and skills; articulate growth and development through storytelling.

5c5228ba-43d4-473e-9b2e-ff9fe75db61e.description: Offered by Experiential Learning Network, this badge is part of the ELN Digital Badges micro-credential program. Earners of this badge are effectively prepared for project development.
5c5228ba-43d4-473e-9b2e-ff9fe75db61e.name: Project Preparation

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the required activities in the Project Portal; submit a 250-300 word context summary; complete a NACE competency self-assessment; develop project goals and intentions.

af3dec62-e411-4917-aeb6-3902638ce187.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this micro-credential program explores the elements of the Pharmacists’ Patient Care Process (PPCP). Badge earners will demonstrate their knowledge of this patient-centered approach to care through simulated interviews and medication counseling.
af3dec62-e411-4917-aeb6-3902638ce187.name: Introduction to applying the Pharmacist Patient Care Process for Doctor of Pharmacy Students

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all introduction to PPCP learning modules, videos, readings, and assessments. Perform simulated medication history/adherence assessment and simulated basic medication counseling.

c7dc3f21-1dc1-4294-a896-da105aac34fa.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential provides recognition of development in the LeaderCORE competencies, vital for effective performance and successful leadership. Earners of this badge demonstrate critical skills, in the areas of self-management and adaptability, results orientation, interpersonal relationships, communication, teamwork and collaboration, team leadership, problem-solving and decision making, global and diversity mindset, strategic thinking and integrity.
c7dc3f21-1dc1-4294-a896-da105aac34fa.name: MBA LeaderCORE

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of LCD I & II by earning a grade of B or better; participation in the Creative Problem Solving and Ropes workshops; Development logs; Passage of the Certification Defense.

bb3a50a9-dd59-4dd7-9203-7900ac2ea51d.description: Offered by the Office of Fellowships and Scholarships, this badge recognizes learners' ability to compete for about competitive external fellowships. Badge earners have the necessary skills to assess their own strengths, envision their futures and create plans to become competitive for major fellowships and scholarships.
bb3a50a9-dd59-4dd7-9203-7900ac2ea51d.name: SPARK: Fellowships and Scholarships Development Program

badge_template_activities.title: Attend eight out of nine of the Spark workshops and participate in discussions; Complete reflective journal prompts and assignments and meet with an advisor from the Office of Fellowships and Scholarships for an individual appointment.

39808b77-3ae0-49df-9d76-5dc13939254e.description: Offered by the Division of Student Life, this badge recognizes learning acquired through on-campus job experiences. The earner of this badge has participated in the Here to Career program and has gained competencies relating to critical thinking, and global awareness/intercultural fluency.
39808b77-3ae0-49df-9d76-5dc13939254e.name: Here to Career: Change Agent

badge_template_activities.title: Be an on-campus employee in a Student Life unit. Take  on a leadership role in a club or organization; have  your resume reviewed and a mock interview appointment with Career Services; attend a workshop that  relates to work ethic, leadership or career management; present at or  attending  the LEAD UB Conference; submit a completed  supervisor verification form; submit a revised resume.

adc8f00c-a176-48b4-a4b3-fcc4de6ac937.description: Offered by the School of Management, this badge is designed to enhance personal and professional leadership skills for non UB Students. It allows participants to enhance their LinkedIn profiles with evidence from a year-long development program, which will show potential employers their participation in a truly trans-global engagement with peers from across different countries and to show case their own development journey while allowing participants to reflect on their experiences.
adc8f00c-a176-48b4-a4b3-fcc4de6ac937.name: Global Collaboration & Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Complete one-year cycle; Attend all online workshops/sessions; Submit weekly journal entries; Collaborate on team project; Meet with mentors.

006cc774-b1cb-474a-8308-866fae51e272.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for learners to gain and apply intercultural and global competencies. Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge and skills pertaining to economic development, social innovation and community engagement. This badge is issued to graduate students.
006cc774-b1cb-474a-8308-866fae51e272.name: Intercultural and Global Competency

badge_template_activities.title: Complete (country specific) consulting project on social innovation; Provide comprehensive report/presentation to clients; Showcase achievements via LinkedIn profile; Complete 3 reflective journals.

2d63823e-b145-46c7-bbdb-b29c5fb474b3.description: Offered through the Collaborative Learning and Integrated Mentoring in the Biosciences (CLIMB) program, this badge is one component of the Ph.D. STEM Professional Readiness micro-credential. Badge earners are able to demonstrate time-management skills; develop a strong CV; identify short and long-term academic and career goals; examine responsible conduct of research, and more.
2d63823e-b145-46c7-bbdb-b29c5fb474b3.name: STEM Graduate Program Readiness

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all in-person workshops and successfully complete all workshop assignments. Submit a written reflection detailing the professional and career development gained from participating in the workshop.

559eda64-2457-411e-b736-3878ac1a535f.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential recognizes successful completion of an experiential learning opportunity offered to students pursuing their Master of Finance at UB. Badge earners have are able to design and execute a corporate finance project, collaborate with corporate executives, analyze business problems and have gained experience with managerial data modeling.
559eda64-2457-411e-b736-3878ac1a535f.name: Finance Academy

badge_template_activities.title: Attend career workshops, guest speaker presentations and company visits; Participate in a team to design and execute a corporate finance project; Complete  oral and written presentations.

cfd58a87-1e4b-4beb-b276-d30c0238b379.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential recognizes achievement in the "Experience the 50" domestic programs. “Experience the 50” programs are each 1-credit courses that cap off with an experiential learning trip to one of the 50 states. Earners of this badge have explored various industries to determine how they can make an impact in major cities/state across the country. This badge is awarded to graduate students.
cfd58a87-1e4b-4beb-b276-d30c0238b379.name: Business Practices in the U.S.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete mini-case project and present it to alumni and professionals; Showcase achievements via LinkedIn profile; Present  experience to the global advisory council.

24b34f46-bf2e-44dc-b5ef-f9d6f324aef5.description: Offered by the Department of Electrical Engineering, this micro-credential enables learners to showcase the advanced integrative technical knowledge obtained through their extensive graduate study. Badge earners will explore the scientific and societal impact of their work, synthesize the advanced technical knowledge acquired through a professional experience, and disseminate this knowledge through critical evaluation and project-based learning.
24b34f46-bf2e-44dc-b5ef-f9d6f324aef5.name: Synthesis and Communication of Electrical Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of EE 616: Technical Synthesis and Communication; and completion of an ePortfolio.

030446c6-ef19-46d3-a57e-f7f18c6715a6.description: Offered through the Collaborative Learning and Integrated Mentoring in the Biosciences (CLIMB) program, this badge is one component of the Ph.D. STEM Professional Readiness micro-credential. Badge earners have gained practical skills for giving a scientific presentation, and have demonstratedability to develop a good hypothesis-driven research proposal, and to create an abstract.
030446c6-ef19-46d3-a57e-f7f18c6715a6.name: STEM Graduate Research Communication

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all in-person workshops and successfully complete all workshop assignments. Prepare a formal presentation of research progress.

16339863-5a68-4b9e-b3ec-5c5eff98a447.description: Offered by the Division of Student Life, this badge recognizes learning acquired through on-campus job experiences. The earner of this badge has participated in the Here to Career program and has gained competencies relating to workplace collaboration.
16339863-5a68-4b9e-b3ec-5c5eff98a447.name: Here to Career: Collaborator

badge_template_activities.title: Be an on-campus employee in a Student Life unit. Lead  a group project at work or in class; join or start  a student club;create a LinkedIn profile and attend a Career Services workshop to optimize it;write and post  a substantial thought piece on social media ; submit a completed  supervisor verification form

5e7c50a0-141e-4b93-873d-ad2d19d40071.description: Offered by Experiential Learning Network, this badge is part of the ELN Digital Badges micro-credential program. Earners of this badge have demonstrated self‐awareness of collaboration‐related skills, strengths and competencies and areas for growth; ability to reflect on skills and competencies developed through all phases of their project; and experience in communicating competencies and evidence in support of professional and academic goals using a digital platform.
5e7c50a0-141e-4b93-873d-ad2d19d40071.name: Project Reflection

badge_template_activities.title: Complete self-assessment and written description of project experience; complete 1 20-min online workshop provided through the ELN and upload 1 paragraph summaries; complete and upload a final connected narrative project.

39a1d006-2697-4f8d-834d-d0fdb1785a34.description: Offered by Experiential Learning Network at the University at Buffalo, this badge recognizes successful completion of a mentored project related to global collaboration. Badge earners have completed the requirements for project preparation, engagement and reflection, and demonstrated their ability to leverage their project experience through capacity building and storytelling.
39a1d006-2697-4f8d-834d-d0fdb1785a34.name: Global Collaboration

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the following criteria: Create a plan to further leverage project experience; enhance resume by translating experience and skills; articulate growth and development through storytelling.

90f2e518-a7ac-47a2-88be-c8b81e415758.description: Offered by the University at Buffalo, Center for Leadership and Organizational Effectiveness, this micro-credential equips participants with the essential skills needed to be an effective external or internal coach. Earners of this badge have gained foundational leadership coaching skills, and assessment and feedback skills. They have also gained real-world coaching experience under the supervision of program facilitators.
90f2e518-a7ac-47a2-88be-c8b81e415758.name: Leadership Coaching Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of four non-credit courses that total 100 hours of training, preparation and coaching.  The four courses, that run over nine months, include: 1. Foundations of Coaching; 2.  Assessment and Feedback; 3.  Advanced Coaching;  4.  Practicum.

1b753e3c-b741-4797-9ec0-aae9e5471029.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this micro-credential recognizes demonstrated excellence in academic achievement and an interest in postgraduate residency training. The earner of this badge has gained enhanced scholarship, education/teaching and leadership experience and is prepared to to excel in post-graduate training.
1b753e3c-b741-4797-9ec0-aae9e5471029.name: Pharmacy Scholarship, Education, Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of required coursework (10 credits) and participation in 3 co-curricular activities (scholarly activity, journal club, and professional presentation).

52c238a5-87d6-4a58-aa46-1cc3ada0198f.description: Offered by the Department of Community Health and Health Behavior, the micro-credential provides a means to develop the skills and knowledge required for addressing health inequities. Badge earners have demonstrated expertise on the origins of health inequities and are equipped with the necessary tools for intervening to eliminate health disparities.
52c238a5-87d6-4a58-aa46-1cc3ada0198f.name: Strategies for Eliminating Health Inequities

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion (grade of B or better) of two of the following courses- CHB 525: Health Disparities; CHB 524: A Public Health Approach to Understanding and Reducing Sexual Risk Behaviors; CHB 523: Introduction to Program Planning and Evaluation (either in person or online); CHB 500: Indigenous Health Disparities; UP508: Class, Gender, and the City. CHB 522: Refugee Health for Populations Conceptualize and prepare a slide deck for a presentation of a strategy for reducing health inequities.

789407d9-72b8-453c-a2f5-fab01ebeee25.description: Offered by the Clinical and Translational Science Institute, this badge provides recognition of skills in communicating the ways that principles of ethics are integrated into the design, conduct, oversight and dissemination of research. Badge earners are able to identify conflicts of interest and methods to ensure ethical procedures are used with animals and human participants, as well as criteria for determination of authorship and the role of peer review in funding and publication.
789407d9-72b8-453c-a2f5-fab01ebeee25.name: CTSI Responsible Research

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the CTSI Core Competency in Responsible Conduct of Research Workshop Series and  earn a grade of ""complete"" on all case study assignments.

c7bdc314-7e91-4f35-9f20-8543bfd1758c.description: Offered by the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences , this undergraduate micro-credential program brings students together from multiple disciplines to solve problems where technology and applied sciences are potentially part of the solution. The earner of this badge has demonstrated ability to participate in a collaborative project-based experience to solve an authentic technology and applied sciences relevant problem.
c7bdc314-7e91-4f35-9f20-8543bfd1758c.name: Engineering Intramural

badge_template_activities.title: Successful participation (beginning to end) in an engineering intramural project activity;summative reflection of project experience; participation in a mock interview via Career Services;summative reflection on interview feedback/performance.

6a6f71df-4889-4a2f-af60-5ba57ec30914.description: Offered by Experiential Learning Network at the University at Buffalo, this badge recognizes successful completion of a mentored innovation project. Badge earners have completed the requirements for project preparation, engagement and reflection, and demonstrated their ability to leverage their project experience through capacity building and storytelling.
6a6f71df-4889-4a2f-af60-5ba57ec30914.name: Innovation

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the following criteria: Create a plan to further leverage project experience; enhance resume by translating experience and skills; articulate growth and development through storytelling.

3cade951-3877-4b38-a833-398e71b37db8.description: Offered through the Collaborative Learning and Integrated Mentoring in the Biosciences (CLIMB) program, this micro-credential provides career and professional development to Master's students in STEM fields. Through this program you will learn how to collaborate with colleagues of different personality types and organize your commitments by developing time management skills. The importance of responsible research and professional networking will be emphasized to help you prepare for your career.
3cade951-3877-4b38-a833-398e71b37db8.name: Master’s STEM Professional Readiness

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the CLIMB Pathways online & in-person workshops;  completion of all workshop assignments; final oral presentation of the student's research progress.

89f4a8ef-d861-40c7-a72d-72fdf09550df.description: Offered by Experiential Learning Network at the University at Buffalo, this badge recognizes successful completion of a mentored creative project. Badge earners have completed the requirements for project preparation, engagement and reflection, and demonstrated their ability to leverage their project experience through capacity building and storytelling.
89f4a8ef-d861-40c7-a72d-72fdf09550df.name: Creative Work

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the following criteria: Create a plan to further leverage project experience; enhance resume by translating experience and skills; articulate growth and development through storytelling.

1bb613bd-a2d5-47e9-b1ac-6124d2bf3071.description: Leading self is one of four badges in the Jacobs School Leadership Track (JSLT). The earner of this badge is able to effectively communicate in a team setting and lead impactful meetings.
1bb613bd-a2d5-47e9-b1ac-6124d2bf3071.name: Jacobs School Leadership Track (JSLT)- Leading Self

badge_template_activities.title: Attend 80% of monthly workshops; Lead monthly workshop;successful completion (grade of 70% or greater) of end of course exam; submit Quarterly HSS/clinical experience reflection and project update.

b6d52222-8638-4feb-b974-a09f0a8bcf05.description: Leading in Healthcare is one of four badges in the Jacobs School Leadership Track (JSLT). The earner of this badge has a deep understanding of healthcare delivery structures and the impact of organizational behavior on those systems.
b6d52222-8638-4feb-b974-a09f0a8bcf05.name: Jacobs School Leadership Track (JSLT)- Leading in Healthcare

badge_template_activities.title: Attend 80% of monthly workshops; Lead one monthly workshop; successful completion (grade of 70% or greater) of end of course exam; submit Quarterly HSS/clinical experience reflection and project update.

e548cf45-bee6-431c-84bb-0efa8200c6a5.description: Offered by Experiential Learning Network, this badge is part of the ELN Digital Badges micro-credential program. Earners of this badge are able to successfully communicate with project partners; demonstrate problem-solving skills; and demonstrate follow-through by completing a project.
e548cf45-bee6-431c-84bb-0efa8200c6a5.name: Project Engagement

badge_template_activities.title: Submit an initial project plan; share an initial project plan with a mentor; submit log documenting partner feedback and adjustments made, showing proof of partner approval/acceptance/endorsement of the project; submit copy/evidence of final project.

26643021-b8ba-4fb4-a59e-d8842f0982de.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for learners to gain and apply intercultural and global competencies. Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge and skills pertaining to economic development, social innovation and community engagement. This badge is issued to undergraduate students.
26643021-b8ba-4fb4-a59e-d8842f0982de.name: Intercultural and Global Competency

badge_template_activities.title: Complete (country specific) consulting project on social innovation; Provide comprehensive report/presentation to clients; Showcase achievements via LinkedIn profile; Complete 3 reflective journals.

e69ae306-a285-43b1-82ef-95d44af83e41.description: Offered through the Collaborative Learning and Integrated Mentoring in the Biosciences (CLIMB) program, this badge is one component of the Ph.D. STEM Professional Readiness micro-credential. Badge earners have gained competencies relating to the development of strong, competitive research proposals.
e69ae306-a285-43b1-82ef-95d44af83e41.name: Graduate Scientific Communication for Success

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all in-person workshops and successfully complete all workshop assignments. Prepare a research proposal and trainee background narrative.

5a98cebf-9213-4053-87e6-ce77370c9450.description: Offered by the School of Social Work, this micro-credential focuses s on the unique and distinct needs, issues and concerns that are experienced by people with serious illnesses and resulting disabilities. Through a combination of academic coursework and experiential opportunities, badge earners will develop the skills for practice with people who have serious mental and/or physical illnesses, and intellectual, developmental and other disabilities across the continuum of care.
5a98cebf-9213-4053-87e6-ce77370c9450.name: Social Work Practice in Serious Illness Care

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of SW568: Serious Illness Care and  SW710: Grief Across the Life; Participation in a monthly classroom-to-field seminar; and a final reflective self-evaluation.

25a37651-0017-4cc6-a30d-5d1dcee7ec9f.description: Offered by the Division of Student Life, this badge recognizes learning acquired through on-campus job experiences. The earner of this badge has participated in the Here to Career program and has gained competencies relating to work ethic, career management, and leadership.
25a37651-0017-4cc6-a30d-5d1dcee7ec9f.name: Here to Career: Growth Mindset

badge_template_activities.title: Be an on-campus employee in a Student Life unit. Participate in one of the following programs: Diversity Zone Training; Intercultural Leadership Retreat; Alternative Break experience; Student Leadership International Dialogue and Exchange (SLIDE) ; submit a completed  supervisor verification form.

1e7d782f-d592-4c07-b76b-fbafa7bebbb2.description: Offered by the Clinical and Translational Science Institute, this badge provides recognition of skills in investigating methods to communicate clinical and translational research findings to different groups of individuals.Badge earners are able to write summaries of scientific information for use in the development of clinical health care policies, which can then be translated into national health strategies or guidelines for use by the general public.
1e7d782f-d592-4c07-b76b-fbafa7bebbb2.name: CTSI Scientific Communication

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the CTSI Core Competency in Scientific Communication Workshop Series; earn a grade of "complete" on all required assignments including the Project Description, Project Abstract, Project Audience, Project Video, Project Presentation, and Final Reflection.

b98d67db-105a-4b9f-98c8-094f3c687759.description: Offered by the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering, the Quality Engineering micro-credential prepares learners for careers in quality improvements of products and services in various industry, military, and government agencies. Earners of this digital badge have demonstrated ability in quality assurance, quality management, and quality improvement.
b98d67db-105a-4b9f-98c8-094f3c687759.name: Quality Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 of the three courses; demonstrate a good understanding of the subjects in a mini-thesis at the end of the three courses as an integrative project that includes quantitative and qualitative aspects of Quality Engineering.

952e78c1-5939-40ff-ac9d-8bde68ef7a73.description: Offered by the School of Nursing, this program provides a pathway for UB School of Nursing DNS alumni to obtain a retroactive degree conversion from DNS to PhD. Earners of this badge have demonstrated their achievements as nurse scientists and leaders who are scholars in research, practice, policy, and/or education.
952e78c1-5939-40ff-ac9d-8bde68ef7a73.name: Academic Scholarship in Nursing

badge_template_activities.title: Submit a current CV that demonstrates scholarly achievement in a combination of two of the following criteria: 1. 13 publications in peer-reviewed journals. 2. An h index of 4. 3. Contributions to the development of health-related guidelines or policies on a regional, national or international level. 4. Consultation as an academic research partner in clinical settings 5. Recognition by peers for expertise, excellence, and innovation, or serving in leadership positions on healthcare boards.

a322b7b6-5e8a-4c55-a8b7-f4e98038810b.description: Offered through the Collaborative Learning and Integrated Mentoring in the Biosciences (CLIMB) program, this badge recognizes achievement in the Ph.D. STEM Professional Readiness micro-credential. Badge earners are able to collaborate with colleagues with different personality types, and organize commitments by developing time management skills, and understand the importance of responsible research and professional networking.
a322b7b6-5e8a-4c55-a8b7-f4e98038810b.name: PHD STEM Professional Readiness

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all assignments for the following workshops: STEM Graduate Readiness; STEM Graduate Research Communication;  and Graduate Scientific Communication for Success. Submit a written personal statement detailing the professional and career development gained from participating in the program.

7a70b6db-8a08-4ac8-a7ce-40fd94f49f11.description: Offered by the Clinical and Translational Science Institute, this micro-credential will prepare learners to be ethical researchers throughout their careers. Badge earners will investigate how to prepare applications for IRB approval, the essential elements of voluntary informed consent, principles of the protection of human subjects & the main authoritative bodies, key codes, and scope for enforcement related to human subject research.
7a70b6db-8a08-4ac8-a7ce-40fd94f49f11.name: CTSI Good Clinical Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the CTSI Core Competency in Good Clinical Practice Workshop Series;  Successful completion of all required weekly assignments & the final reflection.

29be7e6e-6137-4a50-8f7c-741487e099f6.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for learners to enhance their Excel skills. Earners of this badge have demonstrated competencies in using spreadsheets as a tool to model data and to support decision-making in the workplace.
29be7e6e-6137-4a50-8f7c-741487e099f6.name: Data Modeling using Excel

badge_template_activities.title: Complete five modules: Excel Fundamentals, Basic Excel Skills, Intermediate Excel Skills 1, Intermediate Excel Skills 2, and Advanced Excel Skills. Successful completion of all assignments and quizzes.

fe583884-3afa-4688-862d-58509040e1d5.description: Offered through the Collaborative Learning and Integrated Mentoring in the Biosciences (CLIMB) program, this badge provides career and professional development to UB undergraduate students from STEM fields, and students from across the country as part of the CLIMB Undergraduate Program. The CLIMB program offers research opportunities, mentoring, and professional development workshops to help its scholars develop into well-rounded professionals who will be leaders in their chosen fields.
fe583884-3afa-4688-862d-58509040e1d5.name: Undergraduate STEM Professional Readiness

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all in person workshops and successfully complete all workshop assignments.

74b3773a-88b0-43be-ade5-a31b31f37226.description: Offered by the Department of Restorative Dentistry, the Esthetic Dentistry micro-credential enables students to develop a deep and broad understanding of contemporary restorative dental techniques, materials and treatments. Badge earners are able to apply both new and conventional techniques and materials systems important in the practice of contemporary restorative dentistry.
74b3773a-88b0-43be-ade5-a31b31f37226.name: Esthetic Dentistry

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of RDN 864; Participation in arranged lectures and Esthetic Dentistry Concentration workshops; Completion of at least three clinical projects.

2fec131e-67f5-4181-900d-4544d51049fe.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, and part of the Pharmacometric Software Series, this badge is intended for users with no or limited experience in working with R. Badge earners will learn the basic concepts needed to efficiently work with R, how to manipulate and visualize datasets using the modern R packages dplyr, tidyr, and ggplot, and how R can be used for PKPD simulations. Workshop instructor: Jasmine Hughes, PhD
2fec131e-67f5-4181-900d-4544d51049fe.name: R for Data Science and Pharmacometrics

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in a 2-day workshop and successfully complete assignment that entails developing R scripts that are reproducible, readable, and communicative.

b96c7879-26bf-447d-bfc8-30b37910f649.description: Offered by Experiential Learning Network at the University at Buffalo, this badge recognizes successful completion of a mentored creative project. Badge earners have completed the requirements for project preparation, engagement and reflection, and demonstrated their ability to leverage their project experience through capacity building and storytelling.
b96c7879-26bf-447d-bfc8-30b37910f649.name: Sustainability

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the following criteria: Create a plan to further leverage project experience; enhance resume by translating experience and skills; articulate growth and development through storytelling.

9a6ed57a-2981-40b2-bfa8-982ca785d800.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this badge is part of the Application of the Pharmacy Patient Care Practice micro-credential program. Earners of this badge are able to demonstrate the SCHOLAR-MAC process and effectively collaborate with patients or caregivers to provide patient-centered care.
9a6ed57a-2981-40b2-bfa8-982ca785d800.name: Applying the Pharmacist Patient Care Process to Self-Care

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all self-care PPCP learning modules, videos, and assessments. Perform two simulated self-care patient encounters as well as two self-care patient encounters supervised and verified by practicing pharmacists.

ad5ad47c-c8d9-4015-884b-3a4c54f49869.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for learners to gain competency in the following areas: Self-Management & Adaptability, Results Orientation, Interpersonal Relationships, Communications, Teamwork and Collaboration, Team Leadership, Problem-Solving & Decision-Making, Global & Diversity Mindset, Strategic Thinking and Integrity. Badge earners have developed and strengthened these competencies and demonstrated preparation for the world of work.
ad5ad47c-c8d9-4015-884b-3a4c54f49869.name: Foundations of LeaderCORE

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the following: Reflection logging; LeaderCORE Foundations I - 1.5 credit course; LeaderCORE Foundations II - 1.5 credit course; Courses meets once per week, 7-10 times per semester (online and in-person); Comprehensive reflection on the development of behavioral skills Interview.

da0c987e-9ae9-45f5-8387-99825177405e.description: Offered by the School of Social Work, this micro-credential prepares learners to work effectively with veterans and military families. Badge earners have successfully completed hands-on, practice-oriented coursework and fieldwork and and are equipped to make a positive impact on this population.
da0c987e-9ae9-45f5-8387-99825177405e.name: Veteran and Military Family Focus

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following components: SW720: Introduction to Issues in Veteran and Military Family Care; Advanced year veteran-related Field placement; Advanced year VMF Interprofessional Education (IPE) seminar; Preparation of a portfolio of military-related assignments; Statement of Student Learning

a7308410-8e30-416a-9d9f-2af8db0f5e31.description: Leading in Healthcare is one of four badges in the Jacobs School Leadership Track (JSLT). The earner of this badge has a deep understanding of healthcare delivery structures and the impact of organizational behavior on those systems.
a7308410-8e30-416a-9d9f-2af8db0f5e31.name: Jacobs School Leadership Track (JSLT)- Leading in Service

badge_template_activities.title: Attend two Junior Track mentee workshops with junior mentee 360 evaluation; complete individual project with presentation; co-mentorship on projects wand submit mentoring meeting summaries to the faculty mentor.

3757e177-d67d-428b-8544-f7ebf12160a7.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential recognizes achievement in the "Experience the 50" domestic programs. “Experience the 50” programs are each 1-credit courses that cap off with an experiential learning trip to one of the 50 states. Earners of this badge have explored various industries to determine how they can make an impact in major cities/state across the country. This badge is awarded to undergraduate students.
3757e177-d67d-428b-8544-f7ebf12160a7.name: Business Practices in the U.S.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete mini-case project and present it to alumni and professionals; Showcase achievements via LinkedIn profile; Present  experience to the global advisory council.

de0be773-c1fb-4b3c-bcb8-d962fe7829b2.description: Offered by The Graduate School and Blackstone LaunchPad & Techstars, this micro-credential recognizes graduate students for their preparation, dedication, and achievement of an intentionally tailored professional development experience. Earners of this badge are able to effectively articulate strategies and techniques to communicate graduate-level research to a non-specialist audience.
de0be773-c1fb-4b3c-bcb8-d962fe7829b2.name: Three Minute Thesis: Communicating Research to Broad Audiences

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must complete four workshops to learn the skills required to compete in the Three Minute Thesis. The workshops are: Communicating to a Non-Specialist Audience, Presentation Zen, Pitch + Presence, and Asynchronous 3MT Data Visualization. Additionally, learners must participate in a Peer Pitch Experience in which they will practice their own pitch with other graduate students in a constructive learning environment.

12014bc3-6c8d-47bf-b2cd-3b9e07f5a1c0.description: Offered by Blackstone LaunchPad, the Inclusive Launch Foundry micro-credential empowers women and students from diverse backgrounds to be innovators, entrepreneurs, makers and creators. Earners of this badge have participated in an accelerated startup training and internship program, and have developed their research and business ideas into ventures that apply the latest in entrepreneurial thinking.
12014bc3-6c8d-47bf-b2cd-3b9e07f5a1c0.name: Inclusive Launch Foundry

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the workshop series, a pitch deck, and a business model canvas; present ideas through the final program pitch competition; fulfill the internship requirement with a local entrepreneur through our partnership with the WNY Incubator Network.

ec50aeef-ed89-473e-9e99-6cf0d148176e.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, and part of the Pharmacometric Software Series, this badge recognizes implementation of PK/PD and systems pharmacology models and workflows using MATLAB® and SimBiology®. Badge earners are able to build mechanistic models of PK and/or PD; Simulate a model; Import data and compare with model simulations; Calibrate models to data. Workshop instructors: Fulden Buyukozturk, PhD – MathWorks and Sietse Braakman, PhD - MathWorks
ec50aeef-ed89-473e-9e99-6cf0d148176e.name: Pharmacology modeling in SimBiology

badge_template_activities.title: Workshop participation; successful completion of an assignment that demonstrates ability to  build a 1 compartment coupled to a PD model of bacterial growth.

285b05de-a6f4-4c7a-a60e-bd86752fa75d.description: This micro-credential is offered by the Jacobs School of Medicine and Biomedical Sciences. Participants of this student-led, and doctor-and-patient supported program, have acquired a working knowledge of diabetes and diabetes management and treatment and are able to act as advocates and mentors to actual diabetes patients.
285b05de-a6f4-4c7a-a60e-bd86752fa75d.name: Diabetes Mentorship Program

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge participants must successfully work with their assigned diabetic mentee patient;  Complete all assignments including weekly reflections on interactions with diabetic mentee and analyzing case studies; Submit a summary and review of their own specifically assigned diabetic mentee as a case study.

f7378d51-7b5a-4a06-aef1-855581c20c29.description: Offered by the Division of Student Life, this badge recognizes learning acquired through on-campus job experiences. The earner of this badge has completed all requirements of the Here to Career program and has gained competencies relating to workplace collaboration, critical thinking, global awareness/intercultural fluency, work ethic, career management, and leadership.
f7378d51-7b5a-4a06-aef1-855581c20c29.name: Here to Career: Achievement

badge_template_activities.title: Be an on-campus employee in a Student Life unit.  Successful completion of each of the following Here to Career badges- "Collaborator," "Growth Mindset," and "Change Agent". Submit final  response to a reflection framework and supervisor evaluation.

7ee73ef9-1472-4901-8088-21fe59bf4519.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for PharmD and Pharmaceutical Sciences graduate students to attain leadership and program planning experience. Badge earners have worked with a team to develop and offer events and workshops for the Pharmacy Summer Institute (PSI), an annual pre-pharmacy summer camp for middle, high school, and college students.
7ee73ef9-1472-4901-8088-21fe59bf4519.name: Pharmacy Summer Institute Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of monthly planning meetings and the development of innovative workshop ideas for the Pharmacy Summer Institute (PSI), an annual pre-pharmacy summer camp for middle, high school, and college students.

1900c28b-2690-482d-95a4-96c26fdb85f8.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential provides an opportunity to gain intensive foundational training in Nonprofit Board Leadership. Earners of this badge have participated in an academic year of service as a non-voting board member with a Western New York nonprofit organization, and have gained an understanding of board governance, servant leadership, diversity and inclusion principles, and inter-cultural leadership.
1900c28b-2690-482d-95a4-96c26fdb85f8.name: Nonprofit Board Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Pre-requisite: Be enrolled in the UB School of Management's MBA program (traditional, full-time MBA including dual degree students, and the PMBA). Requirements include the completion of a foundational training course; attendance at board meetings; development an action learning project that supports the goals of the non-profit; and participation in monthly fellowship group discussions.

d5a7805a-3863-47bc-8b6d-b3aa2be06e8b.description: Offered through School of Dental Medicine, this badge recognizes pre-doctoral students' understanding of: oral health care delivery to underserved patient populations, advocacy efforts to promote oral healthcare delivery and education and research that support Dental Public Health.Badge earners have demonstrated ability to work with/in support of underserved populations.
d5a7805a-3863-47bc-8b6d-b3aa2be06e8b.name: Competency in Dental Public Health

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate proficiency in Public Health Dentistry by completion of 6 one-hour, non-credit AAPHD lectures; Complete 20 hours participation in community-based service project(s) sponsored / endorsed by UBSDM's AAPHD student chapter; Participate and collaborate on research in the field of Dental Public Health as submitted in written, oral, or poster format; Earn a final grade of 'B' or better in the Fall Semester 3rd Year course PDO 836.

3ca9b778-19d3-4c48-ad86-92f87fc98f38.description: Offered by the Center for Advancement of Sport,this micro-credential provides learners with an introduction to the fundamental ideas in applying data analytics to issues surrounding key regulatory and management functions within the sports industry.
3ca9b778-19d3-4c48-ad86-92f87fc98f38.name: Data Analytics in Sports Law

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all learning modules, assignments and final project.

30773ad4-1d1d-481b-b452-dde850201083.description: Offered by the School of Dental Medicine in collaboration with the School of Nursing, School of Public Health and Health Professions, and the Community for Global Health Equity, this badge is part of the Addressing Health Disparities program. Earners of this badge have provided donated dental care to underserved communities outside of the United States.
30773ad4-1d1d-481b-b452-dde850201083.name: International Outreach

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in an international outreach experience organized by the School of Dental Medicine or the School of Nursing; be able to engage in a multidisciplinary team to provide direct patient care; complete a reflection paper at the conclusion of the experience.

19cb3e2d-725e-4281-ab9a-8b70b828bd64.description: Offered by the School of Management's Center for Leadership and Organizational Effectiveness, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for participants to enhance their leadership abilities. Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge and skills to lead effectively across the organization and increased their capacity for strategic decision-making.
19cb3e2d-725e-4281-ab9a-8b70b828bd64.name: Leadership Accelerator Program

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of six instructional sessions on leadership; Successful completion of a verbal report and an Action Learning Project which demonstrates new and/or improved leadership behaviors.

51249268-c35e-4b78-ba8f-8a3a8126ddb5.description: Offered by the School of Social Work , this micro-credential program represents a three-course study that enables learners to recognize and respond to child abuse and neglect. The earner of this badge is able to recognize and respond to child maltreatment; describe risk and protective factors for children; identify appropriate prevention and response strategies for child maltreatment; and defend the need for child advocacy in promoting social justice and working toward a non-violent world.
51249268-c35e-4b78-ba8f-8a3a8126ddb5.name: Child Advocacy Studies (CAST)

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the following courses, with a grade of B or higher: SSW 225 Perspectives on Child Maltreatment and Advocacy;  SSW 235 Do we really care about kids? Rethinking child welfare in the U.S;  SSW 245 Global Child Advocacy Issues. As well as a portfolio submission.

f4785d2b-dfbc-475e-9e04-fb7c88b9b8f3.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential provides an opportunity to learn the most effective ways to build dashboards using Microsoft Excel's powerful data modeling and business intelligence tools: Power Query, Power Pivot, Power View and Power BI. Earners of this badge are able to use these tools to make effective data visualizations for reports and presentations.
f4785d2b-dfbc-475e-9e04-fb7c88b9b8f3.name: Data Modeling and Dashboards using Excel

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the following units: Import/Get Data into Power Query; Transform Data in Power Query; Import II/Introduction to DAX functions and the Data Model; Power Pivot; Power BI, Power View and Power Map.

b022ce70-4f0a-4a72-9e6a-d9a4cf41cffb.description: Offered by the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences, this micro-credential provides basic training in data science practice and communications. Badge earners have gained data literacy skills through hands-on engagement with professional applications, ethical principles, and visualization fundamentals of data science.
b022ce70-4f0a-4a72-9e6a-d9a4cf41cffb.name: Data Science in Engineering

badge_template_activities.title: Complete EAS 345: Introduction to Data Science; EAS 346: Communicating with Data;  350 hours of a data science internship, and a multimedia capstone activity.

37be5cc4-eaff-4725-a0cf-dc9c80fe82c6.description: Offered by the School of Social Work, the Excellence in Aging micro-credential provides the knowledge and skills needed to improve the care and well-being of older adults, their families, and caregivers. Earners of this badge are prepared to successfully work with, and on behalf of, the older population, and has demonstrated leadership skills in gerontology.
37be5cc4-eaff-4725-a0cf-dc9c80fe82c6.name: Excellence in Aging

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of two courses: SW 706: The Aging Population and Their Families  and SW721: Social Policy and Programs for the Aging Population; participation in the “Emerging Topics in Aging” seminar series; completion of a reflection paper assignment.

542d807e-4b15-47f0-800e-d5e4f13c5cfc.description: Offered by the Department of Sociology, the micro-credential provides specialized training in diversity issues in the U.S. criminal justice system. Upon completion, learners are familiarized with sociological theories and research in the fields of criminology, gender, race, class, sexuality, and immigration. Earners of this badge are prepared to think critically about power, inequality, and marginality in the criminal justice system.
542d807e-4b15-47f0-800e-d5e4f13c5cfc.name: Crime and Justice in a Diverse Society

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion (grade of B or better) in SOC 211: Sociology of Diversity plus two elective courses from the list on this topic area offered by the Department of Sociology; Completion of a paper in response to pre-defined prompts concerning issues of crime and justice in a diverse society.

667c9581-094a-4d3a-99df-8a0f464e447c.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this program allows students to engage in a competency-based global health curriculum and become “Global Citizens,” a standard recognized by the Consortium of Universities for Global Health. Learners complete a global health outreach elective course, as well as a set of online learning modules, and participate in at least one international immersive experience sponsored by UB School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences.
667c9581-094a-4d3a-99df-8a0f464e447c.name: Global Health Pharmacy

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of  PHM 561: Global Health Outreach & PHM 628: International Experiences; Non-credit online learning modules;  participation in at least one international immersive experience sponsored by the UB School of Pharmacy & Pharmaceutical Sciences.

f43434f3-68e8-4da3-b27a-1c81e5a74f7f.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this badge is part of the Pharmacometric Software Series. Badge earners are able to fit compartmental models to PK/PD Data in Phoenix WinNonlin; assess if a model is adequate; compare different models; simulate dosing regimens using models in Phoenix; and understand basic principles of population PK modeling.
f43434f3-68e8-4da3-b27a-1c81e5a74f7f.name: PK/PD Modeling using Phoenix

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in a two day workshop which provides an introduction to  pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamics principles using Phoenix WinNonlin as well as familiarization with Phoenix NLME.  The badge was obtained after successfully obtaining a passing score on a test and successfully performing an exercise in Phoenix that demonstrates the understanding of concepts presented at the workshop.

1f73dc8f-6d7e-40de-b717-6d2d1b2a34a6.description: Offered by the Center for Advancement of Sport, this badge is part of the Data Analytics in Sports Law micro-credential. Earners of this badge have gained an understanding of data techniques used to address key sports administrative functions in team and roster management.
1f73dc8f-6d7e-40de-b717-6d2d1b2a34a6.name: Player Performance and Roster Management

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all learning modules, assignments, and quizzes; demonstrated ability to use analytic tools and analysis techniques to manage and substantiate player movement and associated salaries within assigned constraints.

ae070e0c-2d56-4beb-b4f1-5d1fed2ee3a5.description: Offered by Clinical and Translational Science Institute, this program prepares participants to be effective educators within interprofessional, interdisciplinary, & culturally diverse groups of individuals. Open to graduate students in health care professions, learners will develop foundational knowledge of adult learning principles, educational strategies, content delivery techniques, and learner and program assessment techniques.
ae070e0c-2d56-4beb-b4f1-5d1fed2ee3a5.name: CTSI Effective Teaching

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the CTSI Core Competency in Effective Teaching Workshop Series ; Successful completion of the required weekly assignments & the final reflective presentation.

3b03b88b-469d-44fa-905b-068f7d0d3aea.description: Offered by the Office of Student Engagement, this badge is part of the Developmental Experiences micro-credential program. Earners of this badge are able to articulate the components of effective leadership, critically examine the benefits and limitations of certain leadership styles, and understand the role that identities play in leadership styles.
3b03b88b-469d-44fa-905b-068f7d0d3aea.name: Developmental Experiences: Strategic Leaders Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of 3 co-curricular experiences offered through student engagement, and a final reflection paper, PowerPoint, or video presentation based on learning outcomes from the experiences.

559fb7fc-ac26-4b88-a147-bd3343f5088a.description: Offered by The Graduate School and Blackstone LaunchPad & Techstars, this micro-credential recognizes graduate students for their preparation, dedication, and achievement of an intentionally tailored professional development experience. Students that have earned this badge have demonstrated their ability to effectively communicate their research to broad audiences.
559fb7fc-ac26-4b88-a147-bd3343f5088a.name: Three Minute Thesis: Advanced Practitioner

badge_template_activities.title: Pre-requisite: Three Minute Thesis: Communicating Research to Broad Audiences Badge Learners must: - Meet three times with a Blackstone LaunchPad Venture Coach; Participate in the Pitch Prep Seminar where they will build a presentation roadmap and workshop their 3-minute pitch; Participate in the Presentation and Slide Development workshop to learn advanced techniques; Plan and design a quality presentation; Participate in Three Minute Thesis Finals Competition.

ab18b464-bd4f-430b-84f1-939e5aa868e9.description: Offered by the Department of Sociology, this micro-credential represents a three course study focused on diversity. The earner has a deep understanding of the opportunities and challenges arising from diversity in families, communities, schools, and workplaces. Earners of this badge are well-equipped to think critically about power, diversity, inequality and marginality in US institutions.
ab18b464-bd4f-430b-84f1-939e5aa868e9.name: Understanding Diversity through Sociology

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete SOC 211: Sociology of Diversity, plus two additional courses from the list of diversity electives offered by the Sociology Department; submit a paper written in response to one of two paper prompts; submit a diversity statement for an employer

a4c8ba41-a0c8-471f-bcc5-2ab91f17160e.description: Offered by the English department, this micro-credential provides foundational skills in professional writing and digital communication. The earner of this badge is able to identify and analyze professional communication genres and practices; evaluate best practices for digital communication in professional contexts; apply common methods of rhetorical analysis to study professional communication; and compose in a range of digital environments.
a4c8ba41-a0c8-471f-bcc5-2ab91f17160e.name: Digital Composition

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of two courses: ENG503: Professional Writing and Digital Communication and ENG602: Digital Communication and Rhetoric); Submission of a portfolio of digital projects.

46927acd-0d29-4ffa-8f3e-04976b5bef09.description: Medical Student Excellence in Leadership is one of four badges in the Jacobs School Leadership Track (JSLT). The earner of this badge has successfully completed three years in the Leadership Track and has attained the Leading Self, Leading in Healthcare and Leading in Service badges.
46927acd-0d29-4ffa-8f3e-04976b5bef09.name: Jacobs School Leadership Track (JSLT)- Medical Student Excellence in Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all 3 prior digital badges: JSLT Leading Self, JSLT Leading in Healthcare, and JSLT Leading in Service.

9ef4f449-bce7-4ff1-a4fc-4715f4aa9ef0.description: Offered by the School of Nursing, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for DNP and MS nursing students to gain knowledge and skills of concepts, strategies, and processes related to quality and safety in healthcare. Earners of this badge are able to identify process errors to reduce the incidence of medical errors and sentinel events, and have gained collaborative and interprofessional strategies to achieve quality outcomes within the healthcare environment.
9ef4f449-bce7-4ff1-a4fc-4715f4aa9ef0.name: Quality and Safety in Healthcare

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of NGC 634 Organizational and Leadership Concepts in Health; Completion of the Institute for Healthcare Improvement (IHI) modules; Development of a quality improvement proposal; Development of a short video presentation using the Pecha Kucha presentation technique.

602226d5-898c-47e0-a050-e7f2d7e425a7.description: Offered by the Department of Sociology this micro-credential represents advanced training in the study of Applied Social Research. The earner has the ability to design clear, concise, ethical, and thorough research studies; collect and analyze data; communicate research ideas, methodological approach, and findings in written and oral formats; identify strengths and weaknesses of different research methods; interpret, apply, and perform basic statistical techniques in order to test hypotheses.
602226d5-898c-47e0-a050-e7f2d7e425a7.name: Applied Social Research

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of SOC 504 (Introductory Statistics for the Social Sciences) and SOC 606 (Social Research Methods) and 3 workshops from the Summer Research Institute.

abe7f48d-125a-40c8-9921-95c533b42655.description: Offered by the Department of Communications, this graduate micro-credential program represents a three-course study that enables learners to develop effective messages and campaigns for diverse career fields, including (but not limited to) marketing, health, or politics. The earner of this badge is able to apply principles of persuasive communication in specific circumstances and across media platforms (such as social media or print messages).
abe7f48d-125a-40c8-9921-95c533b42655.name: Communication Campaigns

badge_template_activities.title: Complete at least one foundational course (COM 540: Persuasion and Social Influence; COM 629: Entertainment-Education for Health Promotion and Social Change; or COM 682: Audience Analysis and Program Evaluation).Also complete two additional COM courses, which may be a combination of electives or additional foundational courses.Develop a communication campaign.

ea9dd317-c9d1-431e-b4d1-bffbbe540e66.description: Offered bythe Community of Excellence in Global Health Equity (CGHE), this digital badge is par of the Big Ideas to Advance Global Health Equity badge series. Earners of this badge have gained insight into global health inequities, as well as tactics for promoting equity in global health and wellness. Earners have also demonstrated an understanding of co-created knowledge and its relationship to global health equity.
ea9dd317-c9d1-431e-b4d1-bffbbe540e66.name: Co-Production of Knowledge for Global Health Equity

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least 6 out of the 9 CGHE Co-Production of Knowledge for Global Health Equity seminars offered; Complete Reflection Papers for each seminar attended; Develop and submit a Culminating Project that synthesizes information disseminated in the seminar series and communicates an understanding of co-created knowledge and its relationship to global health equity.

e3beda58-f8a5-41b3-a226-e0d96010afc1.description: Offered by the Community for Global Health Equity, this digital badge is part of the Big Ideas to Advance Global Health Equity micro-credential. The micro-credential provides an opportunity for participants to gain insight into issues relating to global health inequities. Earners of this badge have gained an understanding of how to form effective partnerships and equitably engage in research in Global South communities.
e3beda58-f8a5-41b3-a226-e0d96010afc1.name: Co-Production of Knowledge for Global Health Equity

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of 6 seminars; submission of reflection papers for each seminar attended; completion of a culminating project that is responsive to the content of the seminar series and demonstrates learned tactics for promoting equity in global health and wellness.

1233d886-3ee3-4044-bd97-3b44aa0d6018.description: Offered by the School of Dental Medicine in collaboration with the School of Nursing, School of Public Health and Health Professions, and the Community for Global Health Equity, this badge is part of the Addressing Health Disparities program. Earners of this badge have provided donated dental care to underserved communities within the United States.
1233d886-3ee3-4044-bd97-3b44aa0d6018.name: National Outreach

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in a national outreach experience organized by the School of Dental Medicine or the School of Nursing; be able to engage in a multidisciplinary team to provide direct patient care; complete a reflection paper at the conclusion of the experience.

3306ec85-07ce-4b41-aec2-9ffc84ff19c4.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this micro-credential prepares leaders in pharmacy clinical and translational research. The earner of this badge is able to ask critical clinical questions; formulate a hypothesis; write a research proposal; and conduct research under the guidance of a faculty mentor.
3306ec85-07ce-4b41-aec2-9ffc84ff19c4.name: Clinical Pharmacy Research

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the following courses - PHM 598: Professional Problems (two semesters); PHM 554: Seminar; Research presentation

2680b561-846e-4dc1-8b60-9ca6bed6fa41.description: Offered by the Office of Academic Integrity, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for participants to develop ethical skills to enhance their academic pursuits and subsequently prepare them for professional careers with integrity. Earners of this badge are able to communicate critical terminology and concepts related to academic ethics, advocate for the value of integrity and critically think about and enhance ethical practices in the workplace.
2680b561-846e-4dc1-8b60-9ca6bed6fa41.name: Academic Ethics

badge_template_activities.title: Pre-requisite: Concurrent participation as a Student Integrity Ambassador within the Office of Academic Integrity and maintaining a 2.5 GPA are required. Learners must: Complete 75 hours volunteering through the Office of Academic Integrity and a capstone project.

9b7c5e8a-ab18-4da8-b46b-f8dcceb42e9b.description: Offered by the School of Dental Medicine in collaboration with the School of Nursing, School of Public Health and Health Professions, and the Community for Global Health Equity, this badge is part of the Addressing Health Disparities program. Earners of this badge have provided donated dental care to underserved communities both within and outisde of the United States, and have gained competencies in Global Health.
9b7c5e8a-ab18-4da8-b46b-f8dcceb42e9b.name: Addressing Health Disparities

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all of the requirements for the "National Outreach" and "International Outreach" badges.

9bb5912a-c645-4a94-8a97-24ec1e5ca096.description: Offered by the Center for Advancement of Sport, this badge is part of the Data Analytics in Sports Law micro-credential. Earners of this badge have gained an understanding of the data analysis tools and the laws and regulations applicable to the representation of the elite athlete throughout the various stages of his/her career.
9bb5912a-c645-4a94-8a97-24ec1e5ca096.name: Analytics, Law and Athlete Representation

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all learning modules, assignments and final project.

37a1b928-d7a1-4e37-95e0-36e4c176a1d1.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this badge is part of the Application of the Pharmacy Patient Care Practice micro-credential program. Within inpatient settings, learners demonstrate their aptitude in the creation of care plans and consultations; the arrangement of care coordination; providing of medication-related education and self-management training; and communication with patients, caregivers, and other healthcare professionals to provide patient-centered care.
37a1b928-d7a1-4e37-95e0-36e4c176a1d1.name: Application of PPCP with a focus on Inpatient Pharmacy practice

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all inpatient care learning modules, videos, and assessments. Extract data from simulated inpatient patient health records. Verbally communicate a patient presentation using simulated data. Create one care plan that demonstrates PPCP steps on a real patient. Create one consult that demonstrates PPCP steps on a real patient.

47ecb318-7c8b-4649-a51a-f468f5a01ebe.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this badge is part of the Application of the Pharmacy Patient Care Practice micro-credential program. Within outpatient settings, learners demonstrate their aptitude in the execution of care plans, provision of necessary medication-related education and self-management training, interpretation of outcomes of care, and the communication with the patient, caregiver, and other health-care professionals to provide patient-centered care.
47ecb318-7c8b-4649-a51a-f468f5a01ebe.name: Application of PPCP with a focus on Outpatient Pharmacy practice

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all Outpatient (Medication Therapy Management(MTM)/Comprehensive Medication Management (CMM)) pharmacy practice learning modules, videos, and assessments. Attend the didactic component of the APhA MTM Certificate program. Complete one  MTM encounter with a real or simulated patient.  Complete one MTM encounter with a real patient.

d7cda872-4a23-4213-9bd6-0ccfe8a6a9e9.description: Offered by the Office of Student Engagement, this badge is part of the Developmental Experiences micro-credential program. Earners of this badge have developed a comprehensive set of practical skills and tools including time management, public speaking, budgeting management, conflict management, and effective communication.
d7cda872-4a23-4213-9bd6-0ccfe8a6a9e9.name: Developmental Experiences: Organizational Development Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all workshops and successfully complete all workshop assignments.

23251e3c-49dc-41a0-bc6f-845af04eb741.description: Offered by the School of Public Health and Health Professions, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for student assistants to learn how to effectively facilitate learning . Earners of this badge have gained translatable skills relating to the learning management system and teaching best practices.
23251e3c-49dc-41a0-bc6f-845af04eb741.name: Facilitating Learning in Public Health

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all learning modules, including self-guided quizzes and a culminating project.

67747d31-6f4a-485e-aaab-c9ad8cf788af.description: Offered by the Department of Global Gender and Sexuality Studies, this micro-credential program provides a strong foundation in feminist visual literacy. The earner of this badge has demonstrated skills in analyzing visual material from a perspective of feminist and queer theories and methodologies.
67747d31-6f4a-485e-aaab-c9ad8cf788af.name: Feminism and Visual Literacy

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of three courses, including one foundation course-  GGS 526: Feminism, Art, Culture; GGS 523: Queer Theory; or GS 661 Special Topics: "The Problem of Life: Feminist and Queer Biopolitics,” as well as two additional  courses, which may be a combination of electives (relating to Feminist Visual Literacy) or additional foundation courses; Completion of a conference presentation or paper that uses feminist, gender or queer analysis to analyze images or visual culture.

cadeda58-6ac3-4db7-ac8e-2f693b8726d2.description: Offered by the College of Arts and Sciences, this micro-credential provides fundamental aesthetic strategies needed to begin writing original poetry and fiction.Earners of this badge have gained skills in writing poetry and fiction, and have also gained knowledge and insight pertaining to publishing opportunities, and the many career opportunities in the fields of writing, editing and publishing.
cadeda58-6ac3-4db7-ac8e-2f693b8726d2.name: Foundations of Creative Writing

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a grade of B or better in ENG207: Introduction to Creative Writing, and either ENG390: Creative Writing: Poetry OR ENG391: Creative Writing: Fiction; Write and revise a final piece of writing as a portfolio artifact; Develop an introductory critical statement about the piece/project.

f8a986b5-02f5-421a-ac82-45ed906669b0.description: Offered by the Department of Global Gender and Sexuality Studies, the micro-credential prepares learners to work in a range of organizations that are increasingly involved with issue of gender inequality and globalization. Badge earners are able to identify ways in which gender inequality shapes global patterns of migration, education, economics, politics and development as well as how women have responded to global challenges around climate change, violence, conflict and human rights abuses.
f8a986b5-02f5-421a-ac82-45ed906669b0.name: Gender and Globalization

badge_template_activities.title: Complete (with a B or better) GGS 205: Women in the Global System, plus two additional courses from the list of gender and globalization electives offered by the Department of Global Gender and Sexuality Studies;  Submit either 1) a paper or 2) a poster or 3) give a presentation in response to one of two different themes from the GGSs department; Write a policy brief around gender and globalization.

ecee50d0-4671-47e3-918f-3c477c1594d0.description: Offered by International Education, the Global Dexterity micro-credential program provides an opportunity to develop and practice effective intercultural behavior. Earners of this badge have participated in a global learning program and engaged with new cultures, and are able to demonstrate strong intercultural competence.
ecee50d0-4671-47e3-918f-3c477c1594d0.name: Global Dexterity

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in a UB-endorsed global learning experience; Successful completion of pre-travel, during travel, and post-travel activities that include reading of the work of Molinksy on Global Dexterity, completion of the Behavior Adaptation Matrix, and participation in a small-group process session; Sharing of the learning experience through selected media.

93eb6b2c-a2ba-4ac0-bc4b-f059c882090b.description: Offered by the English department, in the College of Arts and Sciences, this badge provides recognition of fundraising and grant writing knowledge and experience. Earners of this badge have demonstrated ability to sustain and extend pertinent conversations with nonprofit professionals, and are prepared for fundraising work in the arts, humanities, nonprofit, or related sectors.
93eb6b2c-a2ba-4ac0-bc4b-f059c882090b.name: Grantwriting and Fundraising

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of 4 required course credits; successful completion of field experience project; submission of an abstract/executive summary of one final course project; submit  final written report from  field experience project.

e6df4dc7-ae68-4302-a167-63b0e36bdb3a.description: PK/PD Modeling and Analysis using ADAPT badge is part of the Pharmacometric Software Series offered by the University at Buffalo, School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences. ADAPT is a computational modeling platform developed for pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic applications. It is intended for basic and clinical research scientists and is designed to facilitate the discovery, exploration and application of the underlying pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic properties of drugs.
e6df4dc7-ae68-4302-a167-63b0e36bdb3a.name: PK/PD Modeling and Analysis Using ADAPT

badge_template_activities.title: The requirements for earning the PK/PD Modeling and Analysis using ADAPT Badge are: 1. Participate in a 2-day workshop (full attendance). 2. Perform hands-on exercises during the workshop. 3. Complete an assignment demonstrating knowledge in PK/PD modeling using the ADAPT software.

3f152482-ac1e-424c-9a2f-97acd1c8ee4d.description: Offered by the School of Management, this micro-credential provides an opportunity undergraduate students to gain leadership skills considered vital by the business community for effective performance Badge earners have improved their self-awareness, strengthened leadership competencies, and expanded their professional network.
3f152482-ac1e-424c-9a2f-97acd1c8ee4d.name: Prominence in Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Complete reflection, mentoring, feedback (to self and peers), workshops, projects, and a final oral defense; Completion of MGB 359, MGB 360, and MGB 361 with a grade B or better.

2c158b93-53ac-4ddd-b26b-3b92a3672521.description: Offered by the School of Public Health and Health Professions, this micro-credential provides participants with a hands-on, community-based focused study of public health in global contexts. Earners of this badge are able to apply global and intercultural fluency, critical-thinking and problem-solving abilities and skills in teamwork and collaboration and will be well prepared for opportunities to work on global-health-related issues.
2c158b93-53ac-4ddd-b26b-3b92a3672521.name: Public Health from Global Perspectives

badge_template_activities.title: Pre-requisite: 3.0 GPA; Learners must complete a project in global health research or participate in the global health case competition. Additionally, participants must complete one in-depth, graduate-level project OR two activities to be chosen from researching and presenting topics in a poster format, roundtable or HealthCast episode and/or participation at sponsored events.

07c9a1c2-8c55-4731-900a-38b1e7ae267c.description: Offered by the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for learners to stregthen thier leadership skills. Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Leadership for Engineers and Applied Scientists workshop series and have demonstrated the "power skills" related to leadership that are necessary for career readiness
07c9a1c2-8c55-4731-900a-38b1e7ae267c.name: SEAS 360 Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in 8 workshops; Successful completion of culminating experience.

fc505edf-028f-4ffa-bad5-e8e1ad6f21c4.description: Offered by the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences, this micro-credential provides an opportunity for learners to stregthen thier professional presence and communication skills. Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Professionalism &Communication for Engineering and Applied Scientists workshop series and have demonstrated the "power skills" related to professionalism and communication that are necessary for career readiness.
fc505edf-028f-4ffa-bad5-e8e1ad6f21c4.name: SEAS 360 Professionalism and Communications

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in 8 workshops; Successful completion of culminating experience.

b95482e1-ed16-4ced-a182-02983b820c1e.description: Offered by the Intercultural and Diversity Center, this micro-credential offers an opportunity for students to demonstrate their commitment to diversity through engagement. Earners of this badge have participated in cultural awareness training, and are able to think critically about issues regarding race, gender, sexuality, country of origin, and other marginalized identities.
b95482e1-ed16-4ced-a182-02983b820c1e.name: Social Justice and Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of 5 modules of cultural awareness training and an additional 30 hours of approved diversity-centered engagement experiences.

9fcbdf1b-ace2-4463-8010-0aabb11f9d1d.description: Offered through the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this badge recognizes clinical and translational research excellence for Physician Scientist and Pharmacist Scientist-M.D. and Pharm.D. students. Badge earners have demonstarted successful completion of an intensive oral an written defense including an original manuscript and are prepared to be be competitive on residencies and fellowship.
9fcbdf1b-ace2-4463-8010-0aabb11f9d1d.name: T35 Clinician Scientist Program

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of 1) Mentored laboratory-based research project, 2) Seminar series, 3) Career development component involving interactive small group sessions with faculty, 4) Training in the responsible conduct of research, 5) Oral and poster presentation, 6) PHM 552 and 7) Capstone project  focused on a final written report (i.e. manuscript).

3b0070ef-e1c6-47f9-815d-f9b2c9027a35.description: Offered through the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this badge recognizes clinical and translational research excellence for Physician Scientist and Pharmacist Scientist-M.D. and Pharm.D. students. Badge earners are prepared to be be competitive on residencies and fellowship.
3b0070ef-e1c6-47f9-815d-f9b2c9027a35.name: T35 Research Program

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of 1) Mentored laboratory-based research project, 2) Seminar series, 3) Career development component involving interactive small group sessions with faculty, 4) Training in the responsible conduct of research, 5) Oral and poster presentation.

29aaccfc-dc64-41d1-8360-95f3e344501a.description: Offered by the Department of Comparative Literature, the micro-credential in Theoretical Humanities introduces graduate students (MA and PhD) as well as advanced undergraduate students (who intend to pursue graduate education) to the interdisciplinary theoretical methods of interpreting culture and literature. Badge earners have the ability to apply advanced methods of interpretation in various humanistic disciplines: literary and cultural studies, philosophy, art theory, and film.
29aaccfc-dc64-41d1-8360-95f3e344501a.name: Theoretical Humanities

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion (grade of B or better) of 3 required courses: Introduction to Theory (COL 580) Two "special topics" graduate seminars from regular COL offerings, A section only; Submit titles and the abstracts of three research papers completed in the program.

93292f0e-fcdd-43d5-b9be-4eee3792b6fc.description: Offered by the School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, this badge is part of the Application of the Pharmacy Patient Care Practice micro-credential program. This badge verifies that earners have the ability to provide accurate medication doses and directions; identify discrepancies between levels of care; modify medication plans as needed; and communicate updates to the patient/caregiver.
93292f0e-fcdd-43d5-b9be-4eee3792b6fc.name: Using Medication Reconciliation to Illustrate the PPCP

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all medication reconciliation learning modules and assessments; Perform one simulated medication reconciliation;  Perform two medication reconciliations supervised and verified by practicing pharmacists.
